creditline: The David and Margaret Christenson Endowment for Art Acquisition
description: upside-down, slightly grainy image of head of yellow bird at top of each sheet; turquoise ground with grey smoke lines and waves at bottom of each sheet
marks:
Signature, Date and Title

on verso of sheet, LL on each sheet, verso, LR: [Ann Hamilton 2009]
medium: Digital inkjet monoprints with hand-applied candle soot, sprayed with fixative
text: Installation artist Ann Hamilton created this set of inkjet prints by capturing still images of canaries previously recorded on video. The letters in the title—e, g, b, d, and f—refer to the notes on a musical staff and suggest the tonal range of the American Singer canary, specially bred for its free and melodious song.  Hamilton further enhanced the output by moving a burning candle across the surface of the paper, depositing soot from the burning parafin. The mysterious markings enhance the impression of the birds' fleetings movements.
title: american singers (e, g, b, d, f) (chorus)
